definition: inversion (rhetoric device of inverting the word order for heightened effect)/anastrophe
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
adornment/to adorn/dress/clothing/costume (of an actor in a play)/to play a role/to pretend/to install/to fix/to wrap (sth in a bag)/to load/to pack
sentence/clause/phrase/classifier for phrases or lines of verse

sentences.english: Young as he is , he knows a lot .
sentences.chinese: 倒裝句雖然他很年輕，但他知道得很多。

sentences.english: Inversion is a very common linguistic phenomenon in the English language.
sentences.chinese: 倒裝句是英語中一種常見的語言現象。

sentences.english: This thesis focuses on genre analysis of English resumes.
sentences.chinese: 本文以認知理論爲基礎，對英語倒裝句進行分析研究。

sentences.english: Rewrite the inverted sentences using normal word order.
sentences.chinese: 用正常語序改寫下列倒裝句。

sentences.english: Finally, according to a variety of inversion is the use of an analysis.
sentences.chinese: 最後根據倒裝句很多種不同的使用情況進行了分析。

sentences.english: Previous research on inversion has been done at the syntactic level.
sentences.chinese: 以往的倒裝句研究是在句法平面內進行的。
